etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Chemical News. From German Piperonal from Piper- (in Piperin) + -on + -al

definitions: A crystalline bicyclic aldehyde obtained synthetically and from certain flowers and used in perfumery and flavourings; 1,3-benzodioxole-5-carboxaldehyde, (OCH₂ O)H₃ C₆ —CHO.
